title: Sickening high tackle on Owen Farrell proves the game remains conflicted... rugby is still caught between the old ways and the new
text:
The way Owen Farrell’s World Cup is going, he will do well to remember which country he is in by the time the trophy is awarded. And that is not meant flippantly. For the second consecutive match England’s captain was banjoed jaw-high by a disgraceful shoulder challenge that raised doubts about his capacity to keep absorbing such illegal hits.

Remember the time when Farrell’s own tackling technique was the subject of many a Six Nations slanging match? England’s leader, who seems to have a target on his jersey out here (or, rather, on his chin) has many times been guilty of stopping...
description: The way Owen Farrell’s World Cup is going, he will do well to remember which country he is in by the time the trophy is awarded.
